snippet: Austerity foes claimed a victory as about half of Ireland’s estimated 1.6 million homeowners failed to pay a new $133 property tax by the deadline.
abstract: Irish anti-austerity protesters claim victory after the government acknowledges that around 50 percent of the country's estimated 1.6 million homeowners failed to pay a new, flat-rate $133 property tax by the March 31 deadline.
lead_paragraph: Austerity foes claimed a victory as about half of Ireland’s estimated 1.6 million homeowners failed to pay a new $133 property tax by the deadline.

headline.seo: Half of Irish Homeowners Join Boycott of Household Tax
headline.main: Half of Irish Homeowners Join Boycott of New Property Tax
headline.print_headline: Half of Irish Homeowners Join Boycott of New Tax That Has Symbolized Fiscal Woes
